intro: Houlletia odoratissima f. xanthina, commonly known as the yellow-flowered houlletia, is a rare and ornamental plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow inflorescences. The plant features a slender, unbranched stem with a crown of narrow, pinnate leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, producing a subtle fragrance that attracts pollinators. Due to its rarity and horticultural appeal, it is often cultivated in specialized botanical gardens and conservation programs.
